sentences: Alexander Yurasovsky (June 15, 1890 – January 31, 1922) was a Russian conductor and composer.
He was the grandson of violinist Vasiliǐ Zhakharovich (1842-1907) and son of the opera singer Nadezhda Vasil'evna Salina (1864-1955).

He studied piano with E.P. Savina and musical composition with Peter Nikolaevich Renchitsky, Reinhold Glière and Alexander Gretchaninov, graduating from  Moscow University in 1913 with a degree in law.
6 The way of love songs (lyrics by A. Allyn, 1912)
